I1.name: Cell Division
description: {{sbc|Innate - The Secret Weapon:}} '''Zac''' gains increased percentage [[size]] equal to {{as|{{fd|1.5}}% of his '''bonus''' health}}, capped at 35% increased size at {{as|{{fd|{{#expr:35/0.015 round 1}}{{recurring|3}}}} '''bonus''' health}}. '''Zac's''' size also reduces based on his {{as|'''missing''' health}}, down to 70% '''total''' size while at {{as|0% health}}.

Both '''Zac''' and enemy champions can interact with these chunks by being within 50 units of them: '''Zac''' can move over them to consume them, {{tip|heal|healing}} for {{as|{{pp|type=[[File:Let's Bounce!.png|20px|border]] Let's Bounce!'s rank|key=%|4 to 6.25 for 4|0 to 3}} of his '''maximum''' health}}; enemy champions can move over them to destroy them.

Periodically, upon taking {{tip|death|fatal damage}}, '''Zac''' enters {{tip|resurrection}} for {{pp|8 to 4 for 5|1;6;10;13;17}} seconds and restores {{as|50% of his '''maximum''' health}}, splitting into 4 uncontrollable [[File:Cell_Division.png|20px|link=Zac#Pets]] ''[[Zac#Pets|Bloblets]]''. Each ''bloblet'' has {{as|{{tt|12%|Plus an additional 1 health}} of his '''maximum''' health}} and moves towards '''Zac's''' location over the duration. Any damage the ''bloblets'' receive, excluding damage dealt in excess of their {{as|'''total''' health}}, is also redirected to '''Zac''' in {{tip|true damage|{{as|true damage}}}}. While in resurrection, '''Zac''' is {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|lockout|unable to act}}, and cannot take damage from sources other than the redirected damage from his ''bloblets''.

If any of the ''bloblets'' remain alive by the end of the duration, '''Zac''' is revived with {{as|{{tt|10 - 50%|Based on his bloblets' total remaining health. Reaches the maximum amount at full health on all bloblets}} '''maximum''' health}}. If all bloblets are killed, the resurrection ends and '''Zac''' dies.
I1.descriptionHtml:
Innate - The Secret Weapon: Zac gains increased percentage size equal to 1.5% of his bonus health, capped at 35% increased size at Unknown value: #expr:35/0.015 round 1Unknown value: recurring / 3 bonus health. Zac's size also reduces based on his missing health, down to 70% total size while at 0% health.
Innate: Every time Zac damages at least one enemy with an Champion ability, he sheds, depending on the ability, a number of chunks of himself to a nearby location, landing towards visible nearby enemy champions and lasting for 6 seconds.
Both Zac and enemy champions can interact with these chunks by being within 50 units of them: Zac can move over them to consume them, healing for 0 to 3 ‒ undefined of his maximum health; enemy champions can move over them to destroy them.
Periodically, upon taking fatal damage, Zac enters resurrection for 1;6;10;13;17 ‒ undefined seconds and restores 50% of his maximum health, splitting into 4 uncontrollable File:Cell_Division.png Zac#Pets. Each bloblet has 12% of his maximum health and moves towards Zac's location over the duration. Any damage the bloblets receive, excluding damage dealt in excess of their total health, is also redirected to Zac in true damage. While in resurrection, Zac is untargetable and unable to act, and cannot take damage from sources other than the redirected damage from his bloblets.
If any of the bloblets remain alive by the end of the duration, Zac is revived with 10 - 50% maximum health. If all bloblets are killed, the resurrection ends and Zac dies.
I1.notes:
* The damage directed to '''Zac''' is {{tip|raw damage|internal raw damage}}.
* The ''bloblets'' are {{tip|untargetable}} while splitting, and will not split over terrain.
* '''Zac's''' increased size does not consider his base stats, but does consider {{iis|Gargoyle Stoneplate}} increased base health.
* ''Cell Division's'' chunks spawn in two versions:
** {{sbc|Contestable:}} They will fall to the ground at a point which is roughly equidistant from '''Zac''' and the nearest {{tip|sight|visble}} enemy champion within 1000 range of him (dropping slightly in '''Zac's''' favor). The location at which they fall to the ground is influenced by the direction in which '''Zac''' is currently facing. Cannot be interacted with for the first {{fd|0.25}} seconds (except during {{ai|Let's Bounce!|Zac}}).
** {{sbc|Uncontestable:}} They will fall to the ground near '''Zac''' and can be picked up immediately (version used by default).
* '''Zac's''' {{tip|untargetability}} upon triggering ''Cell Division'' does not {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroy}} in-flight {{tip|projectiles}}.
* {{ai|Chronoshift|Zilean}} and {{ii|Guardian Angel}} will take priority over ''Cell Division''.
* {{ii|Spirit Visage}} and {{sti|Heal Power|link=Heal and shield power}} increases the healing of both ''chunks'' and ''bloblets''.
* {{cai|Realm Warp|Ryze}} is able to individually teleport '''Zac''' or his ''bloblets'' during ''Cell Division''.
** If '''Zac''' is transported to a new location before the ''bloblets'' landed, they will travel to form at his new position, adjusting their speed accordingly. If ''Cell Division's'' duration permits during this time, '''Zac''' will be revived even if the ''bloblets'' fail to recombine.
* ''Cell Division's'' ''bloblets'' can be targeted by {{si|Teleport}} and {{cai|Force of Will|Syndra}}.
** Other ''bloblets'' are not interrupted by the conditions above and will continue to recombine instinctively.
* '''Zac's''' health when the ''bloblets'' are sent out is set to what it would be if all ''bloblets'' recombined, and is actively updated when the ''bloblets'' take damage.
* If '''Zac's''' health is higher than it is supposed to be when the ''bloblets'' converge on him, his health will be set to the correct value.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Zac''' is in resurrection:
{{ct|move=false|cast=false|attack=false|items=false|consume=false|spells=false|interrupts=death}}

Q.name: Stretching Strikes
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Zac''' stretches his left arm in the target direction that catches the first enemy it hits, dealing them {{as|magic damage}}, {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 40% for {{fd|0.5}} seconds, and forming a {{tip|tether}} between '''Zac''' and the target for 2 seconds, during which the target is {{tip|true sight|revealed}}.

While the tether persists, '''Zac's''' next [[basic attack]] is replaced by a second ''Stretching Strike'', empowering it to have a {{fd|0.25}}-second cast time, gain {{sti|25 '''bonus''' attack range}}, deal the same {{as|magic damage}} and apply the same {{tip|slow}}. This attack cannot {{tip|critically strike}}.

If the two ''Stretching Strikes'' affect different targets, both targets are {{tip|root|rooted}} for {{tt|{{fd|0.5}}|Estimated}} seconds and receive the same {{tip|slow}} and, after a {{tt|{{fd|0.4}}-second delay|After the attack's cast time}}, '''Zac''' {{tt|displaces|Only move block, does not stun the target's actions (disables attacking and movement only)}} them towards each other for 300 range, though not through terrain.

If the two targets are {{tt|near|700 range}} each other, they're slammed against each other instead of toward each other via the displacement, both additionally taking the initial {{as|magic damage}} again and becoming {{tip|airborne|knocked up}} and {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|0.25}} seconds upon impact with each other. Enemies near the impact are also dealt the initial {{as|magic damage}}.
Both ''Stretching Strikes'', the cast and the empowered attack, {{tip|basic attack reset|reset}} '''Zac's''' basic attack timer.
Q.descriptionHtml:
Active: Zac stretches his left arm in the target direction that catches the first enemy it hits, dealing them magic damage, slowing them by 40% for 0.5 seconds, and forming a tether between Zac and the target for 2 seconds, during which the target is revealed.
While the tether persists, Zac's next basic attack is replaced by a second Stretching Strike, empowering it to have a 0.25-second cast time, gain 25 bonus attack range, deal the same magic damage and apply the same slow. This attack cannot critically strike.
If the two Stretching Strikes affect different targets, both targets are rooted for 0.5 seconds and receive the same slow and, after a 0.4-second delay, Zac displaces them towards each other for 300 range, though not through terrain.
If the two targets are near each other, they're slammed against each other instead of toward each other via the displacement, both additionally taking the initial magic damage again and becoming knocked up and stunned for 0.25 seconds upon impact with each other. Enemies near the impact are also dealt the initial magic damage.
Both Stretching Strikes, the cast and the empowered attack, reset Zac's basic attack timer.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|40 to 100}} {{as|(+ 30% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{fd|2.5}}% of '''Zac's''' '''maximum''' health)}}|Total Magic Damage|{{ap|40*2 to 100*2}} {{as|(+ 60% AP)}} {{as|(+ 5% of '''Zac's''' '''maximum''' health)}}}}
Q.notes:
* The following features were added in patch [[V7.10]] to increase ''Stretching Strikes''' reliability and usability:
** If the first attack's target is a minion, would die from the damage, and is above a certain amount of health, the minion is instead left at 1 health. The health threshold increases with ''Stretching Strikes''' damage.
** If the second attack's target would die from the damage, it won't be dealt until they are slammed to the first target.
** Non-champion units that are affected by ''Stretching Strikes''' displacement are prevented from taking any damage until they are slammed together. Note that this often confuses players who are trying to secure {{tip|monster|monsters}} via {{si|Smite}} while '''Zac''' is slamming the wanted target, resulting in ''Smite'' dealing no damage to it. It is currently unknown whatever the side effects of this feature are intentional or not.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will block a single instance of damage only.
* If the tethered target is {{tip|untargetable}} during the second ''Stretching Strike'' via basic attack, they are completely unaffected by the ability.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will also resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.
{{Effect at cast time end}}
* If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, {{tip|death|dies}}, or is too far away during the empowered attack's cast time, it is cancelled but not consumed.
* The following refers for interactions during the activation's cast time:
{{ct|cast|spells=true,false,false,false,false}}

effects.str:
• Magic Damage: (+ 30% AP) (+ 2.5% of Zac's maximum health)
  • Total Magic Damage: (+ 60% AP) (+ 5% of Zac's maximum health)

st_slices: (+ 30% AP) (+ 2.5% of Zac's maximum health)

W.name: Unstable Matter
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Zac's''' body explodes outward, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies, capped against {{tip|minions}} and {{tip|monsters}}.
'''Zac''' grants {{tip|ghost|ghosting}} to monsters hit for 5 seconds.
''Unstable Matter's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 1 second every time '''Zac''' picks up a {{ai|Cell Division|Zac}} chunk.
W.descriptionHtml:
Active: Zac's body explodes outward, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies, capped against minions and monsters.
Zac grants ghosting to monsters hit for 5 seconds.
Unstable Matter's cooldown is reduced by 1 second every time Zac picks up a Zac's Cell Division chunk.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|35 to 95}} {{as|(+ {{ap|4 to 8}}% {{as|(+ 4% per 100 AP)}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}}|Capped Damage|{{ap|235 to 295}}}}

effects.str:
• Magic Damage: (+ % (+ 4% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health)
  • Capped Damage:

st_slices: (+ % (+ 4% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health)

E.name: Elastic Slingshot
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Zac''' {{tip|channel|charges}} for up to {{fd|4.5}} seconds to increase ''Elastic Slingshot's'' {{sti|range}} over a cone in the target direction. ''Elastic Slingshot'' can be recast at any time during the channel.

If '''Zac''' {{tt|cancels the channel|Details below}} himself, or the charge completes without reactivation, 50% of ''Elastic Slingshot's'' {{sti|{{as|health cost}}}} and {{sti|cooldown}} are refunded.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Zac''' {{tip|dashes}} to the target location, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies on impact and {{tip|airborne|knocking them up}} and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|0.5}} seconds, increased to 1 second if ''Elastic Slingshot'' was charged for more than 1 second.
''Elastic Slingshot will cast at max range if cast beyond that.''
E.descriptionHtml:
Active: Zac charges for up to 4.5 seconds to increase Elastic Slingshot's range over a cone in the target direction. Elastic Slingshot can be recast at any time during the channel.
If Zac cancels the channel himself, or the charge completes without reactivation, 50% of Elastic Slingshot's health cost and cooldown are refunded.
Recast: Zac dashes to the target location, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on impact and knocking them up and stunning them for 0.5 seconds, increased to 1 second if Elastic Slingshot was charged for more than 1 second.
Elastic Slingshot will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

R.name: Let's Bounce!
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} Increases {{ais|Cell Division|Zac}} healing from chunks.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Zac''' bounces after the cast time, then bounces 3 additional times each second over 3 seconds, during which he also gains {{as|{{pp|type=duration|key=%|20 to 50 for 7|0 to 3}} {{sti|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} but becomes unable to declare basic attacks and use {{ai|Stretching Strikes|Zac}} and {{ai|Elastic Slingshot|Zac}}.
Each bounce deals {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies, {{tip|airborne|knocking them back}} over 1 second and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 20% for the same duration.
Enemies can be hit by multiple bounces, but ones beyond the first deal 50% damage to them and do not apply the {{tip|airborne|knock back}}.
R.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Increases Zac's Cell Division healing from chunks.
Active: Zac bounces after the cast time, then bounces 3 additional times each second over 3 seconds, during which he also gains 0 to 3 ‒ undefined bonus movement speed but becomes unable to declare basic attacks and use Zac's Stretching Strikes and Zac's Elastic Slingshot.
Each bounce deals magic damage to all nearby enemies, knocking them back over 1 second and slowing them by 20% for the same duration.
Enemies can be hit by multiple bounces, but ones beyond the first deal 50% damage to them and do not apply the knock back.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|140 to 280}} {{as|(+ 40% AP)}}|Reduced Damage|{{ap|140/2 to 280/2}} {{as|(+ 20% AP)}}|Maximum Single-Target Damage|{{ap|140*2.5 to 280*2.5}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}}}}
R.notes:
* {{tip|Spell shield}} only blocks a single instance of damage.
* Entering {{tip|stasis (buff)|stasis}} will end ''Let's Bounce!'' prematurely.
* While ''Let's Bounce!'' is active '''Zac''' consumes ''Chunks'' within {{tip|cr|icononly = true}} 300 range.

effects.str: • Chunk Healing: % of his maximum health

• Magic Damage: (+ 40% AP)
  • Reduced Damage: (+ 20% AP)
  • Maximum Single-Target Damage: (+ 100% AP)
